title:
Launch configuration in general The easiest way to create a launch configuration is using the _Run Configuration..._ dialog. This dialog can be accessed in several ways.
By typing menu: Run Configurations... in the Quick Access
By holding Ctrl while pressing the green launch button.
By using the drop down menu of the green launch button and clicking on menu: Run Configurations... in the menu.
In the _Run Configuration..._ you can choose between different launch configuration types:
How to create new launch configurations is described within the picture above.
=== Export a launch configuration Those launch configurations can also be exported to a *.launch file. You can reach the export wizard via export command in the file menu or by typing _Export (Launch Configuration)_ in the Quick Access.
image::export_launch_configuration.png"/>
When pressing Next you can choose, which launch configuration you want to export and define a location to store the *.launch file.
image::launch_configuration_export_wizard.png"/>
The exported Eclipse Application Launch Configuration.launch file looks like this:
As you can see your launch configuration is stored in a XML format, which contains the specific settings of your custom launch configuration.
=== Import a launch configuration The exported launch configuration can of cause be imported as well. You can reach the import wizard via import command in the file menu or by typing _Import (Launch Configuration)_ in the Quick Access.
image::import_launch_configuration.png"/>
When pressing Next you can look for a *.launch file in your file system, and import it.
image::launch_configuration_import_wizard.png"/>
After we successfully imported a certain *.launch file, we can choose and run this launch configuration with the _Run Configuration..._ dialog.
